author: Scott Calvert
title: Pennsylvania GOP Lawmakers to Submit New Map in Gerrymandering Case
text:
Top Republicans in Pennsylvania’s Legislature will meet Friday’s court-imposed deadline to submit a new state congressional map, the latest turn in a high-stakes drama that could help determine control of the U.S. House.
Leaders in the GOP-led state Senate and House are close to finalizing a new map and expect to send new proposed redrawn districts later Friday to Democratic Gov. Tom Wolf, said Drew Compton, chief of staff and counsel to Senate President Pro Tempore Joe Scarnati.
... RELATED VIDEO Is Extreme Gerrymandering Unconstitutional? A ​Supreme Court case on gerrymandering — the practice of drawing district boundaries for political advantage — could reshape the country’s political landscape. Critics say the partisan redistricting undermines representative democracy. Video/Photo: Madeline Marshall/WSJ.
